sn45.49:4.2: “Mendicants, the dawn is the forerunner and precursor of the sunrise.
sn45.49:4.4: In the same way good friendship is the forerunner and precursor of the noble eightfold path for a mendicant.
sn45.49:4.6: A mendicant with good friends can expect to
sn45.49:4.7: develop and cultivate the noble eightfold path.
sn45.49:4.8: And how does a mendicant with good friends develop and cultivate the noble eightfold path?
sn45.49:4.9: It’s when a mendicant develops right view, right motivation, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness,
sn45.49:4.10: and right samādhi, which relies on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripens as letting go.
sn45.49:4.11: That’s how a mendicant with good friends develops and cultivates the noble eightfold path.”
